intro: Viola commutata, commonly known as the common pansy, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Violaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its flowers bloom in early spring and are often used in garden settings for their ornamental value. Viola commutata is also known for its ability to self-seed and spread easily in suitable conditions.
